channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Unknown area exploration for robots with energy constraints using a modified Butterfly Optimization Algorithm
item.description: Butterfly Optimization Algorithm (BOA) is a recent metaheuristic that has been used in several optimization problems.

item.title: Geographic Citation Gaps in NLP Research
item.description: Similar disparities are also believed to exist for paper citation counts.

item.title: Benchmarking Language Models for Code Syntax Understanding
item.description: Our key observation is that existing language models pretrained on code still lack the understanding of code syntax.

item.title: Leveraging Affirmative Interpretations from Negation Improves Natural Language Understanding
item.description: Inspired by the fact that understanding a negated statement often requires humans to infer affirmative interpretations, in this paper we show that doing so benefits models for three natural language understanding tasks.

item.title: Unifying Data Perspectivism and Personalization: An Application to Social Norms
item.description: Instead of using a single ground truth for language processing tasks, several recent studies have examined how to represent and predict the labels of the set of annotators.

item.title: Inducer-tuning: Connecting Prefix-tuning and Adapter-tuning
item.description: Prefix-tuning, or more generally continuous prompt tuning, has become an essential paradigm of parameter-efficient transfer learning.

item.title: Discovering Design Concepts for CAD Sketches
item.description: Sketch design concepts are recurring patterns found in parametric CAD sketches.

item.title: SimpleDG: Simple Domain Generalization Baseline without Bells and Whistles
item.description: We present a simple domain generalization baseline, which wins second place in both the common context generalization track and the hybrid context generalization track respectively in NICO CHALLENGE 2022.

item.title: Eeny, meeny, miny, moe. How to choose data for morphological inflection
item.description: In this paper, we explore four sampling strategies for the task of morphological inflection using a Transformer model: a pair of oracle experiments where data is chosen based on whether the model already can or cannot inflect the test forms correctly, as well as strategies based on high/low model confidence, entropy, as well as random selection.

item.title: OTSeq2Set: An Optimal Transport Enhanced Sequence-to-Set Model for Extreme Multi-label Text Classification
item.description: However, such models can't predict a relatively complete and variable-length label subset for each document, because they select positive labels relevant to the document by a fixed threshold or take top k labels in descending order of scores.

item.title: Federated Fuzzy Neural Network with Evolutionary Rule Learning
item.description: ERL is inspired by the theory of biological evolution; it encourages rule variations while activating superior rules and deactivating inferior rules for local clients with non-IID data.

item.title: CS1QA: A Dataset for Assisting Code-based Question Answering in an Introductory Programming Course
item.description: We introduce CS1QA, a dataset for code-based question answering in the programming education domain.

item.title: Autoregressive Structured Prediction with Language Models
item.description: Recent years have seen a paradigm shift in NLP towards using pretrained language models ({PLM}) for a wide range of tasks.

item.title: A Robust Bias Mitigation Procedure Based on the Stereotype Content Model
item.description: The Stereotype Content model (SCM) states that we tend to perceive minority groups as cold, incompetent or both.

item.title: History-Based, Bayesian, Closure for Stochastic Parameterization: Application to Lorenz '96
item.description: To address these issues, we develop a new type of parameterization (closure) which is based on a Bayesian formalism for neural networks, to account for uncertainty quantification, and includes memory, to account for the non-instantaneous response of the closure.

item.title: RGB-T Semantic Segmentation with Location, Activation, and Sharpening
item.description: The highlight of LASNet is that we fully consider the characteristics of cross-modal features at different levels, and accordingly propose three specific modules for better segmentation.

item.title: Hybrid HMM Decoder For Convolutional Codes By Joint Trellis-Like Structure and Channel Prior
item.description: In this paper, we propose the use of a Hidden Markov Model (HMM) for the reconstruction of convolutional codes and decoding by the Viterbi algorithm.

item.title: Coresets for Vertical Federated Learning: Regularized Linear Regression and $K$-Means Clustering
item.description: Vertical federated learning (VFL), where data features are stored in multiple parties distributively, is an important area in machine learning.

item.title: Pretrained audio neural networks for Speech emotion recognition in Portuguese
item.description: This dataset contains about $50$ minutes of Brazilian Portuguese speech.

item.title: Personalized Federated Learning via Heterogeneous Modular Networks
item.description: Personalized Federated Learning (PFL) which collaboratively trains a federated model while considering local clients under privacy constraints has attracted much attention.

item.title: Comparison of neural closure models for discretised PDEs
item.description: Of the two trajectory fitting procedures, the discretise-then-optimise approach produces more accurate models than the optimise-then-discretise approach.

item.title: Learning on Large-scale Text-attributed Graphs via Variational Inference
item.description: In this paper, we propose an efficient and effective solution to learning on large text-attributed graphs by fusing graph structure and language learning with a variational Expectation-Maximization (EM) framework, called GLEM.

item.title: Synthetic Tumors Make AI Segment Tumors Better
item.description: We develop a novel strategy to generate synthetic tumors.

item.title: SemFormer: Semantic Guided Activation Transformer for Weakly Supervised Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Recent mainstream weakly supervised semantic segmentation (WSSS) approaches are mainly based on Class Activation Map (CAM) generated by a CNN (Convolutional Neural Network) based image classifier.

item.title: Rapid and robust endoscopic content area estimation: A lean GPU-based pipeline and curated benchmark dataset
item.description: The estimation of the content area is a common task in endoscopic image processing and computer vision pipelines.

item.title: Evaluation of Synthetically Generated CT for use in Transcranial Focused Ultrasound Procedures
item.description: Among 20 targets, differences in simulated peak pressure between rCT and sCT were largest without phase correction (12. 4$\pm$8. 1%) and smallest with Kranion phases (7. 3$\pm$6. 0%).

item.title: Decoupled Mixup for Generalized Visual Recognition
item.description: Since the observation is that noise-prone regions such as textural and clutter backgrounds are adverse to the generalization ability of CNN models during training, we enhance features from discriminative regions and suppress noise-prone ones when combining an image pair.

item.title: M$^3$ViT: Mixture-of-Experts Vision Transformer for Efficient Multi-task Learning with Model-Accelerator Co-design
item.description: However, when deploying MTL onto those real-world systems that are often resource-constrained or latency-sensitive, two prominent challenges arise: (i) during training, simultaneously optimizing all tasks is often difficult due to gradient conflicts across tasks; (ii) at inference, current MTL regimes have to activate nearly the entire model even to just execute a single task.

item.title: CU-Net: LiDAR Depth-Only Completion With Coupled U-Net
item.description: We find that existing depth-only methods can obtain satisfactory results in the areas where the measurement points are almost accurate and evenly distributed (denoted as normal areas), while the performance is limited in the areas where the foreground and background points are overlapped due to occlusion (denoted as overlap areas) and the areas where there are no measurement points around (denoted as blank areas) since the methods have no reliable input information in these areas.

item.title: DiffusionDB: A Large-scale Prompt Gallery Dataset for Text-to-Image Generative Models
item.description: We analyze prompts in the dataset and discuss key properties of these prompts.

item.title: Residual Learning of Neural Text Generation with $n$-gram Language Model
item.description: The combination of $n$-gram and neural LMs not only allows the neural part to focus on the deeper understanding of language but also provides a flexible way to customize an LM by switching the underlying $n$-gram model without changing the neural model.

item.title: Scaling Knowledge Graphs for Automating AI of Digital Twins
item.description: Digital Twins are digital representations of systems in the Internet of Things (IoT) that are often based on AI models that are trained on data from those systems.

item.title: ReSel: N-ary Relation Extraction from Scientific Text and Tables by Learning to Retrieve and Select
item.description: We study the problem of extracting N-ary relation tuples from scientific articles.

item.title: BioNLI: Generating a Biomedical NLI Dataset Using Lexico-semantic Constraints for Adversarial Examples
item.description: We introduce a novel semi-supervised procedure that bootstraps an NLI dataset from existing biomedical dataset that pairs mechanisms with experimental evidence in abstracts.

item.title: Reading Between the Lines: Modeling User Behavior and Costs in AI-Assisted Programming
item.description: AI code-recommendation systems (CodeRec), such as Copilot, can assist programmers inside an IDE by suggesting and autocompleting arbitrary code; potentially improving their productivity.

item.title: Towards Interpretable Summary Evaluation via Allocation of Contextual Embeddings to Reference Text Topics
item.description: Despite extensive recent advances in summary generation models, evaluation of auto-generated summaries still widely relies on single-score systems insufficient for transparent assessment and in-depth qualitative analysis.

item.title: Learning to Reuse Distractors to support Multiple Choice Question Generation in Education
item.description: This paper studies how a large existing set of manually created answers and distractors for questions over a variety of domains, subjects, and languages can be leveraged to help teachers in creating new MCQs, by the smart reuse of existing distractors.

item.title: EBEN: Extreme Bandwidth Extension Network applied to speech signals captured with noise-resilient microphones
item.description: We present Extreme Bandwidth Extension Network (EBEN), a generative adversarial network (GAN) that enhances audio measured with noise-resilient microphones.

item.title: Multilingual Relation Classification via Efficient and Effective Prompting
item.description: Prompting pre-trained language models has achieved impressive performance on various NLP tasks, especially in low data regimes.

item.title: Contrastive Search Is What You Need For Neural Text Generation
item.description: Based on our findings, we further assess the contrastive search decoding method using off-the-shelf LMs on four generation tasks across 16 languages.

item.title: Audio MFCC-gram Transformers for respiratory insufficiency detection in COVID-19
item.description: This work explores speech as a biomarker and investigates the detection of respiratory insufficiency (RI) by analyzing speech samples.

item.title: EBEN: Extreme bandwidth extension network applied to speech signals captured with noise-resilient microphones
item.description: In this paper, we present Extreme Bandwidth Extension Network (EBEN), a generative adversarial network (GAN) that enhances audio measured with noise-resilient microphones.

item.title: DEMETR: Diagnosing Evaluation Metrics for Translation
item.description: While machine translation evaluation metrics based on string overlap (e. g., BLEU) have their limitations, their computations are transparent: the BLEU score assigned to a particular candidate translation can be traced back to the presence or absence of certain words.

item.title: Better Few-Shot Relation Extraction with Label Prompt Dropout
item.description: Our experiments show that our approach is able to lead to improved class representations, yielding significantly better results on the few-shot relation extraction task.

item.title: Eigen Memory Tree
item.description: This work introduces the Eigen Memory Tree (EMT), a novel online memory model for sequential learning scenarios.

item.title: Salient Object Detection via Dynamic Scale Routing
item.description: First, instead of using the vanilla convolution with fixed kernel sizes for the encoder design, we propose the dynamic pyramid convolution (DPConv), which dynamically selects the best-suited kernel sizes w. r. t.

item.title: Help me write a poem: Instruction Tuning as a Vehicle for Collaborative Poetry Writing
item.description: The core component of our system is a language model fine-tuned on a diverse collection of instructions for poetry writing.

item.title: Moment Estimation for Nonparametric Mixture Models Through Implicit Tensor Decomposition
item.description: We present an alternating least squares type numerical optimization scheme to estimate conditionally-independent mixture models in $\mathbb{R}^n$, with minimal additional distributional assumptions.

item.title: From Points to Functions: Infinite-dimensional Representations in Diffusion Models
item.description: Consequently, it is reasonable to ask if there is an intermediate time step at which the preserved information is optimal for a given downstream task.

item.title: Information Filter upon Diversity-Improved Decoding for Diversity-Faithfulness Tradeoff in NLG
item.description: Some Natural Language Generation (NLG) tasks require both faithfulness and diversity.
